Thank You

to our valued clients for partnering with us to create this innovative solution:

Introduction

Problem

Credential Training (CT) programs are the most critical component in any successful Epic implementation. If the end-users do not have a good training experience, the adoption of the Epic system is at risk, along with millions of dollars

We have learned through our client experience that every CT program will see a trainer turnover rate of approximately 15 percent. Longer duration programs may see a up to 20 percent.

An Epic implementation is a lengthy process. Whether it’s within the first 60 days, or down to the home stretch, you can’t control when you’ll have a Credentialed Trainer dropout. What you can control is having a plan in place that is designed to minimize the impact of turnover, no matter when it happens along the process.

What happens if we lose our trainers during or after the critical 5-6 week credentialing program?

Short term solution: Partner Reserve Credentialed Trainer Program
Most of the turnover can occur during the short-term (i.e. first 60 days where there is tremendous project flux). Trainers are adjusting (or not adjusting) to the new project, or they may have failed the written exam, or perhaps failed the panel presentations. Our Partner Reserve Credentialed Trainer program solves this short-term problem by building a bench of back-up trainers to immediately backfill CT turnover.

Our Approach:

  • Understand your culture and unique needs
  • Strong emphasis on re-deployment with known resources
  • Present the best trainers vetted on attitude, skill-set and evaluations
  • Reserve CT Program and 72-Hour Trainer Re-Deploy to reduce risk

Resources:

  • 1500 Credentialed Trainers in our CT network in all modules
  • 400 CTs that work with Partner
  • 130 CT’s currently deployed

Partner Reserve Credentialed Trainer Program

We developed this solution by collaborating with our clients on how to solve the reality of CT planned and unplanned turnover. This non-billable program creates an Epic Credentialed Trainer benchfor your CT project to mitigate program risk due to CT resource turnover. This program has frequently saved our clients at critical timesduring the end-user training projects while saving time and money. It also provides coveted peace of mind, which is priceless for massive projects like these with so much at stake.

  • In your local market

    we recruit, train and prepare Reserve Credentialed Trainers that are adult educators (some with clinical mix) that want to learn Epic.

  • The Reserve Trainers

    are fully screened, vetted and tested with trainer aptitude and behavioral analysis tests to be sure they are an appropriate fit for your program.

  • The Reserve Trainers

    will go through your 5-6 week Epic credentialing program to learn your workflows at no charge. They are only billable if and when you need to engage them.

  • Our Epic Certified ID’s

    prepare the trainers for the appropriate modules prior to your CT program start. They also prepare on clinical concepts and terms germane to their area.

  • No Travel Expenses

    they are local resources.

  • These Reserve Trainers

    can also serve as EXCELLENT Go-Live and Activation Support specialists since they will know your workflows. Partner has the ability to create a separate bench for Go-Live support, hence mitigating Go-live turnover.

  • Partner Healthcare IT

    will hire these Reserve Trainers to support your project as well as to support future Partner Healthcare IT projects.

  • You have the

    first right of refusal to hire any of the Reserve Credentialed Trainers that you may like to add to your team.

  • This program helps

    your local community in career and job development.
